item.description:
In the summer of 1953, two eleven-year-old boys—best friends—are playing in a Little League baseball game in Gravesend, New Hampshire. One of the boys hits a foul ball that kills the other boy’s mother. The boy who hits the ball doesn’t believe in accidents; Owen Meany believes he is God’s instrument. What happens to Owen, after that 1953 foul ball, is extraordinary and terrifying. A Prayer for Owen Meany was first published in 1989. This Modern Library edition includes a new Introduction by the author John Irving

                                                  AND

Forty-eight high peaks, one little dog and an extraordinary relationship....Tom Ryan writes about his attempt to climb all 48 of the 4,000 foot mountains of New Hampshire twice in two consecutive winters with his 20-pound Miniature Schnauzer named Atticus M. Finch.  He was on a mission to raise money for cancer and animal charities.

group.name: The Southern NH Books and Brew Club

item.name: Two New Hampshire Authors! A Prayer for Owen Meany and Following Atticus
